nodes.bodyText:
This is something which I don't understand.
Why is this call needed?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -449,12 +463,13 @@ else
       unescaped=$(</dev/stdin)
       stdinText=$(awk 'BEGIN {for(n=0;n<256;n++)ord[sprintf("%c",n)]=n} {text = text $0 ORS} END {split(text, chars, ""); for (i=1; i<=length(text); i++) { if (chars[i] == "\"") { printf("%s", "\\\"") } else if (chars[i] == "\\") { printf("%s", "\\\\") } else if (chars[i] == "\n") { printf("%s", "\\n") } else if (chars[i] == "\t") { printf("%s", "\\t") } else if (chars[i] == "\r") { printf("%s", "\\r") } else if (chars[i] == "\f") { printf("%s", "\\f") } else if (ord[chars[i]] >= 32 && ord[chars[i]] < 127) { printf("%s", chars[i]) } else { printf("\\x%02x", ord[chars[i]]) } } }' <<< "$unescaped")
     fi
-    stdinFile="$(mktemp tmp.stdin.XXXXXXXXXX)"
+    stdinFile="$(mktemp ${tempDir}/tmp.stdin.XXXXXXXXXX)"
     tempFiles+=("$stdinFile")
     printf '\dv{SortString{}}(\"%s\")\n' "$stdinText" > "$stdinFile"
-    configVars="$configVars -c STDIN $stdinFile String korefile"
+    configVars="$configVars -c STDIN $(basename $stdinFile) String korefile"
   fi
-  execute llvm-krun $configVars -d "$kompiledDir" $flags --dry-run -o "$input_file"
+  # llvm-krun creates temp files in the cwd so execute it in $tempDir instead
+  (cd $tempDir; execute llvm-krun $configVars -d "../$kompiledDir" $flags --dry-run -o "$(basename $input_file)")

nodes.bodyText: let's not use find for this. Find is recursive and likely to take longer when you can probably just use a glob.

nodes.bodyText: let's copy over the logic from my PR rather than this warning.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -403,36 +407,46 @@ if [ "$outputFile" = "-" ]; then
   outputFile=/dev/stdout
 fi
 
+# verify and parse config variables/cmd line parameters
 if $term; then
   if [ -z "${parser_PGM+unset}" ]; then
     execute kast -d "$dir" -m "$mainModuleName" "$config_var_PGM" -o kore > "$input_file"
   else
     execute $parser_PGM "$config_var_PGM" > "$input_file"
   fi
 else
+  for configVar in `find $kompiledDir -type f -name 'sort_*' | sed 's|.*sort_\(.*\).txt|\1|'`; do
+    if [[ $configVar != "IO" && $configVar != "STDIN" && ! "${params[@]}" =~ "$configVar" ]]; then
+      error "Configuration variable missing: \$$configVar. Use -c$configVar=<Value> in the command line to set."
+    fi
+  done
   for name in "${params[@]}"; do
     parser_name="parser_$name"
     config_name="config_var_$name"
-    tempFile="$(mktemp tmp.in."$name".XXXXXXXXXX)"
+    tempFile="$(mktemp ${tempDir}/tmp.in."$name".XXXXXXXXXX)"
     tempFiles+=("$tempFile")
-    sortName=`cat "$kompiledDir"/sort_"$name".txt`
-    if [ -z "${!parser_name+unset}" ]; then
-      if [ -f "$kompiledDir/parser_$name" ]; then
-        parser=("$kompiledDir/parser_$name")
-      elif [ "$name" = "PGM" ]; then
-        if $hasArgv; then
-          parser=(kast -d "$dir" -o kore)
+    if [ -f $kompiledDir"/sort_"$name".txt" ]; then
+      sortName=`cat "$kompiledDir"/sort_"$name".txt`
+      if [ -z "${!parser_name+unset}" ]; then
+        if [ -f "$kompiledDir/parser_$name" ]; then
+          parser=("$kompiledDir/parser_$name")
+        elif [ "$name" = "PGM" ]; then
+          if $hasArgv; then
+            parser=(kast -d "$dir" -o kore)
+          else
+            parser=(kast -d "$dir" -m "$mainModuleName" -o kore)
+          fi
         else
           parser=(kast -d "$dir" -m "$mainModuleName" -o kore)
         fi
       else
-        parser=(kast -d "$dir" -m "$mainModuleName" -o kore)
+        parser=("${!parser_name}")
       fi
+      execute "${parser[@]}" "${!config_name}" > "$tempFile"
+      configVars="$configVars -c $name $(basename $tempFile) $sortName korefile"
     else
-      parser=("${!parser_name}")
+      warning "Command line variable $name not found in the configuration. Ignoring."

nodes.bodyText: Uh, it creates the initial configuration that gets passed to the interpreter? It's a very important step.

nodes.bodyText: please don't remove braces like this. I know it's not strictly necessary since there's only one statement inside the braces, but it's still bad code style.

commit.message: Warnings and errors for cmd line vars
kx reports missing configVar and warn extra configVar

Put all temp files in only one dir

TODO: multiple tests for warnings and errors kx and krun
